wiki_catalogs.name: System Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the MERN_chatai_blog system. Explain its purpose as a full-stack AI-powered blog platform with user authentication, content management, admin dashboard, and real-time notifications. Describe the monorepo architecture separating frontend (React/Vite) and backend (Fastify/Node.js) in a unified codebase. Document the high-level interaction between components, including data flow from UI to API to database. Include conceptual overviews for beginners and technical details for experienced developers. Use terminology consistent with the codebase such as Tiptap editor, Fastify controllers, and notification services. Provide practical examples of core user journeys like creating a post or managing users. Illustrate key architectural concepts with diagrams showing frontend-backend separation, API communication, and component hierarchy.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Endpoints Reference
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the RESTful endpoints in MERN_chatai_blog. Document HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas, and authentication requirements for each endpoint group (authentication, posts, users, comments, categories, content, notifications, uploads, AI, and health). For each endpoint, specify parameters, request body structure, response formats, error codes, and examples. Include details on JWT-based authentication, rate limiting, and CORS configuration. Explain how request validation is implemented using schemas and middleware. Provide client implementation guidelines and usage patterns from both frontend and external client perspectives. Address versioning considerations and backward compatibility.

wiki_catalogs.name: Component Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the frontend component architecture of MERN_chatai_blog. Describe the component-based design using React with a clear separation between atomic UI components, feature-specific components, and layout components. Document the composition patterns used throughout the application, including how higher-order components are structured and reused. Explain the role of the Layout component in routing and page structure, and how Outlet is used with React Router. Detail the implementation of lazy loading through lazyComponents utilities for performance optimization, including mobile-specific loading strategies. Include examples of component hierarchies such as the Post creation flow and Admin dashboard components. Address best practices for component organization, naming conventions, and file structure. Provide guidance on when to create new components versus reusing existing ones, and document the error boundary pattern used across critical UI sections.

Explain the relationship with UserContext for state management and API_ENDPOINTS configuration. Address common issues like authentication failures, token expiration, and error handling strategies. wiki_overview.content:
<blog>
# MERN ChatAI Blog Project Analysis

## 1. Project Introduction

The MERN_chatai_blog project is a full-stack blog application built with the MERN stack (MongoDB, Express/Node.js, React, and Node.js) with additional AI capabilities. The application features a comprehensive content management system with admin functionality, user authentication, content filtering, and AI-powered features. The core goals include providing a modern blogging platform with rich text editing capabilities, content moderation tools, and an interactive chatbot interface. The target audience includes content creators, administrators who need robust content management tools, and readers who benefit from a feature-rich blog experience with search, categorization, and responsive design.

## 2. Technical Architecture

The project follows a monorepo architecture with a clear separation between frontend and backend concerns. The backend is built with Fastify, a high-performance Node.js framework, while the frontend uses React with Vite as the build tool. The architecture implements a layered approach with distinct components for routing, controllers, services, and data access.

```mermaid
flowchart TD
  A[Client] --> B[API Layer]
  B --> C[Business Logic]
  C --> D[Data Access]
  D --> E[(Database)]
```

The backend structure follows the MVC pattern with additional layers for validation and configuration. The frontend implements a component-based architecture with React Router for navigation, custom hooks for state management, and context providers for global state. The application uses Redis for caching and implements a sophisticated theme system with both light/dark mode and color theme options.

```mermaid
graph TD
  App[App Component] --> Header[Header]
  App --> Router[Router]
  Router --> Home[Home Page]
  Router --> Post[Post Page]
  Router --> Admin[Admin Dashboard]
  Router --> CreatePost[Create Post]
  Admin --> ContentFilter[Content Filter Admin]
  CreatePost --> Tiptap[Tiptap Block Editor]
  App --> Chatbot[Chatbot Component]
  App --> ThemeProvider[Theme Context]
```

## 3. Key Implementation

### Main Entry Points
- Frontend: src/main.tsx
- Backend: api-fastify/src/server.ts

### Core Modules
- Frontend components: src/components/
- Backend controllers: api-fastify/src/controllers/
- Backend services: api-fastify/src/services/
- Feature modules: src/features/posts/

### Configuration Approach
- Environment variables: Handled through dotenv
- API configuration: src/config/api.config.ts
- Backend server configuration: api-fastify/src/server.ts
- Database configuration: api-fastify/src/config/database.ts

### External Dependencies
- Frontend: package.json
- Backend: api-fastify/package.json

### Integration Points
- Authentication: JWT with @fastify/jwt
- Database: MongoDB with Mongoose
- Email: Nodemailer
- AI: @gradio/client
- Caching: Redis
- File uploads: @fastify/multipart and sharp

```mermaid
graph LR
  Frontend[Frontend] --> Backend[Backend API]
  Backend --> MongoDB[(MongoDB)]
  Backend --> Redis[(Redis)]
  Backend --> Email[Email Service]
  Backend --> AI[AI Service]
  Frontend --> ThemeContext[Theme Context]
  Frontend --> ErrorContext[Error Context]
  Frontend --> UserContext[User Context]
```

## 4. Key Features

The application offers a comprehensive set of features including user authentication, content creation with a Tiptap block editor, admin dashboard with content filtering capabilities, and an integrated chatbot. The content filtering system allows administrators to manage filter words, configure filtering settings, and view statistics on filtered content. The theme system supports both light/dark mode and multiple color themes with persistence via localStorage.

The AI integration enables advanced content processing capabilities, while the notification system provides real-time feedback for user actions and system events. The application implements responsive design with mobile optimizations and follows accessibility best practices.

```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
  [*] --> Initial
  Initial --> Authenticated: Login
  Initial --> Anonymous: Browse
  Authenticated --> CreatePost: Create Content
  Authenticated --> EditPost: Edit Content
  Authenticated --> Admin: Admin Dashboard
  Admin --> ContentFilter: Manage Filters
  Admin --> UserManagement: Manage Users
  CreatePost --> Draft: Save Draft
  CreatePost --> Published: Publish
  Published --> Edited: Update
```

Sources:
- [package.json](/Users/yoricksenpai/MERN_chatai_blog/api-fastify/package.json)
- [main.tsx](/Users/yoricksenpai/MERN_chatai_blog/src/main.tsx)
- [App.tsx](/Users/yoricksenpai/MERN_chatai_blog/src/App.tsx)
- [server.ts](/Users/yoricksenpai/MERN_chatai_blog/api-fastify/src/server.ts)
- [database.ts](/Users/yoricksenpai/MERN_chatai_blog/api-fastify/src/config/database.ts)
- [index.ts](/Users/yoricksenpai/MERN_chatai_blog/api-fastify/src/routes/index.ts)
- [ThemeContext.tsx](/Users/yoricksenpai/MERN_chatai_blog/src/components/contexts/ThemeContext.tsx)
- [ContentFilterAdmin.tsx](/Users/yoricksenpai/MERN_chatai_blog/src/components/admin/ContentFilterAdmin.tsx)
</blog>
